event.title: was established by Archibald Shaw in December 1905

data.event: It was in Malek, a small settlement about 19 kilometres (12 mi) south of Bor, that the first modern Christian mission in present-day South Sudan was established by Archibald Shaw in December 1905.

event.title: led a revolt in the town of Bor, in May of 1983

data.event: Dr. John Garang De Mabior, an officer in the Sudanese Army led a revolt in the town of Bor, in May of 1983, leading to the birth of the Sudan People's Liberation Movement and Sudan People's Liberation Army (SPLM/SPLA).

event.title: 1991 Bor massacre, where approximately 20000 people were killed

data.event: Bor was also the scene of the 1991 Bor massacre, where approximately 20000 people were killed.
Eventually South Sudan became independent on 9 July 2011.
